full_summary:
### MDMP – Medical and Dental Devices Inspection
**Notice Number:** cb-8004-10563528
**Reference Number:** 21401-28-4264838
**Publication Date:** 2023-08-09
**Closing Date:** 2023-09-07T14:00:00

The Correctional Service of Canada is seeking a qualified firm to provide inspection and maintenance services for medical devices and equipment at federal correctional facilities in the Ontario Region.

**Description of Requirement:**

The successful firm will be responsible for performing annual inspections, testing, and calibration of medical devices and equipment to ensure they meet safety and functional standards. The firm will also provide technical support to ensure the quality and effectiveness of medical devices and equipment. This will include identifying repair or replacement needs, and providing guidance on recommended timelines for maintenance and repairs.

**Inspection and Maintenance Requirements:**

* The firm will complete on-site inspections at designated institutions within the Ontario Region.
* Inspections will include testing and calibration of medical devices and equipment to ensure they meet safety and functional standards.
* The firm will identify repair or replacement needs for medical devices and equipment.
* The firm will provide technical support to ensure the quality and effectiveness of medical devices and equipment.

**Location of Work:**

Institutional inspections will take place at various federal correctional facilities in the Ontario Region, including, but not limited to:
+ Bath Institution/Regional Treatment Centre
+ Beaver Creek Institution (Medium)
+ Beaver Creek Institution (Minimum)
+ Collins Bay Institution (Max/Medium)
+ Collins Bay Institution (Minimum)
+ Grand Valley Institution for Women
+ Joyceville Institution
+ Joyceville Minimum
+ Millhaven Institution/Regional Treatment Centre/Regional Hospital
+ Warkworth Institution

**Language and Work Hours:**

The successful firm must perform all work in English, during the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Monday to Friday.

**Contract Duration and Evaluation Criteria:**

The contract will be awarded for a period of three (3) years, with the option to renew for two (2) additional one-year periods. Evaluation criteria will include price, technical capabilities, and past experience.

**Contact Information:**

Monika Alexander, Regional Procurement Officer
Correctional Service Canada, Regional Headquarters, Ontario Region
Phone: 647.234.2934
Email: monika.alexander@csc-scc.gc.ca
Fax: None

**Submission Requirements:**

Bidder must submit their proposals
